thread.section_title: Waikato News: Local Updates & Community Stories - NZ Herald
thread.title: Auckland teen reels in 52kg tuna on jetski in Hauraki Gulf
thread.title_full: Auckland teen reels in 52kg tuna on jetski in Hauraki Gulf

author: @nzherald
title: Auckland teen reels in 52kg tuna on jetski in Hauraki Gulf
text:
[Latest Video]
Auckland teen reels in 52kg tuna on jetski in Hauraki Gulf
Hector de Mornac, 18, caught a 52kg yellowfin tuna from a jetski on Wednesday by Little Barrier Island. Video/ gonefishing3797 Youtube
Unruly passenger stabs AFP police with pen at Perth airport
A 34-year-old woman is now facing charges. Video / Australian Federal Police. Video / Australian Federal Police
NCEA level 1 pass rate revealed and Ministry of Justice privacy breach | NZ Herald News Update
Figures show how many NCEA students achieved level 1 qualification last year and the Ministry of Justice has been encouraged to check its systems following a privacy breach.
Police respond to firearms incident in Pakuranga Heights
Armed police respond to firearms incident at Applejack's Bar & Eatery in Pakuranga Heights. Video / Hayden Woodward
Danielle Collins taunts Australian crowd by slapping backside and boasting of ‘pay cheque’
A “classless” Danielle Collins blew kisses to a hostile Australian Open crowd and thanked fans for helping her land a “big fat pay cheque”. Video / Sky Sport
Derelict building up in flames, Point Chevalier
Firefighters have extinguished a fire at a derelict building in Point Chevalier. Video / Hayden Woodward
A new lease on life at age 103
After losing her home twice, Mavis finds joy in her new life.
Westpac's Satish Ranchhod on food price inflation
Westpac senior economist Satish Ranchhod talks to Tom Raynel about what the rise in food prices means for the wider economy.
NZ Herald Live: Nelson policewoman Lyn Fleming’s farewell
The funeral for slain policewoman Senior Sergeant Lyn Fleming
Kea Kids News: Posh meets plush at Care Bears High Tea
Care Bears are gracing the Cordis! Throw on your glad rags and bring your politest appetite because reporter Maya is in Auckland city for a very special high tea.
Kiwi influencer dating jailed ex-cop
The Diamond Shop owner Sera Lynne has shared a clip featuring Jamie Foster, who was jailed for rape in 2020. Video / Sera Lynne Cruickshank
Jackson Garden-Bachop opens up on brother's death
The 30-year-old is about to begin a new stage in his career, seven months after his shock loss. Video / Michael Craig
Watch: Sail GP teams in Auckland
Sailors testing new T-foils in Auckland conditions ahead of racing. Video / Sail GP
Shark spotted at Whangaumu Bay in Tūtūkākā Coast
A shark was spotted at Whangaumu Bay on Saturday and on Sunday a man had a rendezvous with a 5m great white in Tamaterau near Parua Bay. Video / Masey Hammann
NCEA results released and Lotto ticket ban for under 18s | NZ Herald News Update
160,000 students can check their NCEA results online today and those under 18 will soon be banned from buying Lotto tickets. Video / NZ Herald, AFP
Sea lion city! What’s it like to have these guys as your neighbour?
Reporter Sierra and the St. Kilda Scouts introduce us to the Dunedin sea lions, who are making a stunning comeback thanks to years of conservation efforts.
13-year-old boy died after falling from cliffs in Hāhei
People are still accessing Cathedral Cove via a closed walking track after a young boy on holiday with family at Hāhei fell from the cliffs. Video / Al Williams
Mea Motu sends warning to Ellie Scotney
Boxer Mea Motu discusses her upcoming world title fight against Ellie Scotney in Nottingham on January 26. Video / Dean Purcell
AA's Terry Collins shares why petrol prices are set to rise
AA's Terry Collins talks to Tom Raynel about the international factors causing petrol prices to rise. Video / NZ Herald
Fire threat in Los Angeles continues and firefighters battle Coromandel fire | NZ Herald News Update
Strong wind predictions cause more fire concerns for Los Angeles and firefighters are expected to be battling Coromandel vegetation fire for several days. Video / NZ Herald, AFP
Should you pee on a jellyfish sting? Let’s ask the experts
Reporter Harriet is at Kelly Tarlton’s in Auckland where a new jellyfish exhibit brings you up close and personal with the lava lamps of the sea.
Fire destroys bach
A blaze has destroyed a bach on Nelson’s Boulder Bank. Video / Tim Cuff
Ali Riley loses home in Palisades fire
Football Ferns captain Ali Riley's home in Los Angeles burned to the ground during the recent Palisades fires. Video / Ali Riley
Dangerous winds return to Los Angeles
Dangerous winds have returned to Los Angeles, threatening to worsen wildfires that have killed 16 people. Video / AFP
Watch: 'Crazy' near-miss on North Island road near Turangi
A driver heading home to Rotorua captured a close call on his dashcam when a car crossed the centre line, January 11, 2024.
Watch: Kiwis, NZ-bound tourists stranded in US airport
Travelers, including Kiwis trying to get home, were stranded at Dallas Fort Worth International Airport on Saturday, 11 January 2025, after a snowstorm. Video / Carina Fischer
Where will these dogs run when greyhound racing is put down?
Reporter Rocco meets three sisters who are devastated to see their family’s racing legacy cancelled, and an animal rights advocate who believes it’s what’s best for the dogs.
Water main bursts on Queen Street, CBD
Water main bursts on Queen Street, CBD. Video | Supplied
Orca pod surprises boaties in Hakana Bay, Marlborough Sounds
Orca swam past boaties in Hakana Bay, Port Underwood Marlborough Sounds. Supplied / Vicky Wiblin
LA still on fire, Coromandel burning and the police continue investigations | NZ Herald News Update
Los Angeles is still under seige from flames as our own Coromandel begins to catch alight in the heat. The NZ Police are being kept very busy with investigations; and AI.
A fire burns on Black Jack Road, Coromandel
A fire is burning on Black Jack Road in the Coromandel. Video / Katie Dee
Runner-up Zizou Bergs speaks to media following ASB Classic finals loss
Runner-up Zizou Bergs speaks to media following ASB Classic finals loss. Video / NZ Herald
Gael Monfils wins the ASB Classic
Gael Monfils speaks to media after beating Zizou Bergs in the ASB Classic final. Video / NZ Herald
Man charged with murder in connection with a woman's death in Avondale
A man has been charged with murder following the discovery of a woman’s body in Avondale overnight. Video / NZ Herald
Donald Trump sentenced without penalty and wildfires continue in Los Angeles | NZ Herald News Update
Donald Trump has been sentenced without penalty in the New York hush money case and wildfires continue to burn through Los Angeles. Video / NZ Herald, AFP
Tyre-slasher strikes in Gulf Harbour
A person has been seen slashing tyres in Gulf Harbour before running off. Video / Supplied
Boat busted illegally fishing, Goat Island Marine Reserve
A group of people were caught illegally fishing within the Goat Island Marine Reserve on December 29, 2024. Video / Supplied
Instant karma: Arsonist sets pants on fire during Xmas Day attack
A suspected arsonist was forced to strip off after setting his pants on fire during a Christmas morning attack on a Melbourne shop that backfired. Video / Victoria Police
Mascot race delights at Colgate Games in Hawke’s Bay
Swoop the Magpie, Hawky the Hawk, and Seamore the Seagull compete at the mascot race at the opening of the 2025 North Island Colgate Games at Mitre 10 Sports Park in Hastings.
